intro: Calostephane, commonly known as the "Mexican star-of-Bethlehem," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Calostephane mexicana, which is native to Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats and prefers well-drained soil. Calostephane is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
